page.title: 17THE PUBS IN THE AREA 5
page.content: as a local person. On 'pay-day' the pub is crammed not with iron and coal workers, as it would have been thirty years ago, but with office and management personnel from the town centre or the large industrial estates. The gardens are carefully tended and there are two large car parks. Despite this modernity, the pub shows its local traditions by still running darts and pool teams all year. There is a dominoes team, an air rifle team, and it is the headquarters of Snedshill F.Club. The 'All Labour in Vain' has taken advantage of its position on one of the old coaching roads. In its trade and appearance it reflects the way that Telford's past, when Telford did not exist, is being moulded by the present and how even the pub must bring itself into the post-industrial age.
